titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Earl Fulcher papers 1919.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Len Coombs

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Len Coombs 2003-05
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English.

change.item: Converted to EAD2002 using Word macro and Xmetal
Original encoding in EAD ver. 1.0 from Word 6.0 file using word macros and manual tagging in A/E.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Earl Fulcher papers, 1919.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Len Coombs

did.abstract: Soldier from Sanilac County, Mich., member of Co. H, 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes typescript of his statement relating his experience as a prisoner of war and copies of his enlistment and discharge records.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Leroy Fulcher, of Chelsea, Michigan, in 2003 (Donor no.: 9280).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Earl Fulcher papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Fulcher was a resident of Sanilac County, Mich., who served in Co. H, 339th Infantry, during the American intervention in North Russia.

scopecontent.p: The papers consist of photocopies of a typescript of his statement relating his experience as a prisoner of war and copies of his enlistment and discharge records.
